kizuna_history_b_01:
[VAR BD06(0000)]Why, if it isn’t [VAR TRNAME(0000)] from
class 1-A.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_02:
Are you perhaps interested in the rest of the old
tale I told you in class?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_03:
Heh. It is...convenient that you would take the
bait I presented in class.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_04:
Don’t lie to me. Your desire to fulfill your
intellectual curiosity is made plain as day by that\r
look on your face.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_05:
A vessel, a sword, a set of tablets, and a set of
beads... After obtaining these four treasures, the\r
king’s castle was destroyed. Why, you ask?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_06:
Because these four treasures were actually
four Pokémon![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_07:
As these Pokémon were passed from human hand
to human hand as treasures, they slowly became\r
tainted by hubris and greed.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_08:
Finally, after coming in contact with the rapacity
of the king at that time, they awakened as\r
disasters and began to rampage out of control.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_09:
The king called for renowned Pokémon wielders
to defend the country and, after a fierce battle,\r
these incarnations of disaster were quelled.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_10:
It is said that these four Pokémon were then
sealed away somewhere in Paldea.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_11:
So, what do you think? Would you say this story
is just make-believe?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_12: What?! Where’s your sense of adventure?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_14:
I have read many historical disaster reports,
personal journals, and the like.\c
There is much to support the truth of this story.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_15:
If I am able to prove the story’s veracity myself,
I will be sure to let you know.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_b_system_01: You became even closer with Ms. Raifort!
